title: ‚ú®When LLMs guess, tools know: tool calling in R with ellmer ‚ú®
description:
R-Ladies Cologne are hosting another event! We are excited to have Veerle Eeftink - van Leemput with us, who will share her insights into the world of LLMs üöÄ

**‚ú®When LLMs guess, tools know: tool calling in R with ellmer ‚ú®**
Large language models are great at sounding confident‚Ä¶ and occasionally great at being wrong. Counting things? Doing some calculations? Analysing data? Not their finest moments. In this talk, we‚Äôll look at how R, ellmer, and a bit of tool calling can turn ‚Äúeducated guesses‚Äù into real, reliable, reproducible results. We‚Äôll break down what tool calling actually is, why it matters, and how to use it to make LLMs far more useful in real applications. Expect practical examples, a peek behind the curtain of how these models work, and a few tips and tricks to work successfully with LLMs!

If you‚Äôre up for joining us, RSVP here to get the access.

To stay up-to-date with our future events, make sure to also follow us on [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/rladies-cologne.bsky.social), [mastodon](https://fosstodon.org/@rladies_cologne) and [linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/company/r-ladies-cologne/).

title: From Basics to Advanced Health Analytics: Exploring Diabetes Data
description:
In this session, we will walk through a full end-to-end workflow of health data analysis in R using a simulated database based of diabetes.

We will begin with **exploratory data analysis (EDA)** to identify initial patterns, distributions, and data quality issues. Then, we‚Äôll apply data **wrangling** techniques to prepare the dataset for robust statistical investigation. Building on this foundation, we will create effective and **elegant visualizations** with ggplot2 to communicate insights clearly and intuitively.

Next, we will introduce **inferential modeling** for qualitative outcomes, discussing how to estimate associations, interpret the results, and translate findings into meaningful epidemiological insights.

Finally, we will explore **cluster analysis** to reveal underlying subgroups within the population and highlight the heterogeneity of diabetes profiles.

The session is designed to transition smoothly from basic to more advanced methods, offering a practical and reproducible framework for health data analysis.

No previous experience with medical datasets is required‚Äîall code will be shown step by step and shared afterwards.

title: Lunch & learn with Casey Aguilar-Gervase: Design of Everyday Shiny Apps
description:
Donald Norman‚Äôs *Design of Everyday Things* shows how even smart people struggle with bad design--flipping the wrong switch or pushing instead of pulling. Shiny apps have the same problem when function outweighs experience. As developers, we‚Äôre the door designers, and it‚Äôs our job to make tools people actually enjoy using.
Good news: you don‚Äôt need an art degree to do this. I‚Äôll walk through practical design principles--composition, color, scale, and proportion--and how to apply them directly in Shiny code. With real examples and actionable patterns, you‚Äôll learn how good design becomes not a luxury, but a necessity.

title: tidywater (water chemistry) and building packages using base R
description:
Hello Denver R Ladies!

Please join us on November 4th for a cozy evening of R talks showcasing the awesome work of R users in Denver and surrounding areas.

Doors open at 6:30 p.m., presentations start at 7:00 p.m. We hope to see you there!

This event is co-hosted by Denver R Ladies and Denver R Users.

**Introduction to the tidywater package**
Libby McKenna and Sierra Johnson - Brown and Caldwell

Our package (available on CRAN), tidywater, consolidates public models for water treatment modeling. This package was developed to address the need for a common modeling platform for our industry, drinking water engineering, which previously required assembling results from multiple tools. Additionally, an R Shiny webapp was developed for people who want to access the models, but don't have the time to learn R.
Libby recently presented at posit::conf 2025 in Atlanta

**I'll see you data.table and tidyverse and raise you base R**
Peter DeWitt - CU Anshutz/ NREL

The tools for data manipulation provided by the tidyverse's dplyr and tidyr are extremely useful, as are dcast, melt, and the set\* methods for data.table. However, there is an argument to be made that base R, in some cases, can be preferable to either of these popular R dialects. In this presentation we will explore a specific example where base R methods can be preferable and how to build R packages to support different dialects without dependencies or imports.

title: Workshop - Introduction to R (Part 2)
description:
We're back with Part 2 of our Introduction to R workshop series. While this workshop builds on the previous one, **new participants are also welcome to join us!** We will provide the materials from Part 1 for you to catch up.

We welcome all genders and identities to attend our events at R-Ladies Vienna.

**‚ÑπÔ∏è Abstract**
**R** is a powerful programming language and environment widely used across fields from statistics and economics to psychology, biology, and more. It provides a versatile analytical toolkit for anyone working with data.

The goal of this workshop series is for our attendees to become acquainted with R to start their data analytics journey. In this follow-up session, we will focus on:

* Data processing with the dplyr package
* Data visualization with the ggplot2 package
* Loops, functions, and conditional statements

**üìä Bring your own data!**
If you have a dataset you would like to analyze and visualize during the workshop, we encourage you to bring it along and apply the techniques to your data of interest.

**üí° What to prepare**

* Before the workshop, install **R** and **RStudio** on your laptop by following the 2-step guide at **[https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)**
* On the workshop day, bring your laptop to follow the workshop material closely and code along with us!
* (Optional) Bring a dataset you would like to work with
* (Optional) If you're new to the series, we will send you the link to the Part 1 materials upon registration. Take your time to review the topics we covered in Part 1.
(Basic data types and structures, reading data into R and exporting from R, basic data processing and visualization with base R)

**‚è±Ô∏è Duration**
The workshop will last approximately 1.5 hours. Doors open at 17:45.

In this session, Sharon will offer an accessible, high-level overview of what‚Äôs possible today ‚Äî including how large language models can help you write and improve your R code, as well as add AI-driven features to your applications.

Por fim, apresentaremos os princ√≠pios do causal discovery, oferecendo uma vis√£o inicial de como descobrir rela√ß√µes causais a partir de dados observacionais.

title: Custom city maps in R
description:
Want to learn about geospatial analysis in R? Are your walls looking a little bare? Or maybe you‚Äôre searching for a unique, data-inspired gift for friends or family?
Come join R-Ladies Ottawa for a hands-on workshop where you‚Äôll learn how to make minimalist custom city maps using open-source tools!

**üßê What you'll learn**
In this workshop, we‚Äôll cover:

* The fundamentals of geospatial analysis (e.g., points, lines, polygons, projections)
* How to access and work with OpenStreetMap data
* How to use R packages like osmdata and ggplot2 to create your own beautiful maps
* How to incorporate data from activity tracking apps such as Strava or Runkeeper to visualize your favourite running or cycling routes (time-permitting)

**üß∞ Before the workshop**
To get the most out of this session, please:

* Install R and RStudio (or another IDE such as Positron) on your personal computer
* Clone the workshop repository (code will be shared a few days before the event)
* If you run into setup issues, we can provide access to a Posit Cloud environment as a backup option

**üë©‚Äçüíª At the workshop**
Please:

* Bring your own laptop
* Come ready to learn, share, and contribute to a safe and welcoming community

**This is an in-person event with limited space! Please only RSVP if you are able to attend in-person!**

**\*\*\*Please note that the mission of R-Ladies is to increase gender diversity in the R community. This event is intended to provide a safe space for women and gender minorities. We ask for male allies to be invited by and accompanied by a woman or gender minority.\*\*\***

We‚Äôre grateful to be part of the Bayview Meetups initiative and extend our thanks to Bayview Yards for generously providing the venue space.

title: #stayrelevant: how to keep up with changes in the R ecosystem
description:
Hi R-Ladies SB!

Have you ever returned to an old project only to realize that‚Ä¶

* Your code no longer runs
* Your code runs, but you get a warning about a deprecated function
* A more efficient or modern approach exists
* There‚Äôs an exciting new feature or tool, but your version of R isn‚Äôt compatible

We were curious about best practices for staying on top of new package releases, software updates, and emerging tools (e.g. RStudio ‚Üí Positron, RMarkdown ‚Üí Quarto), so we asked around, only to discover that many of our colleagues were wondering the same thing. So, we decided to turn that curiosity into a community conversation!

**Join us for an open discussion where we‚Äôll** **swap strategies, share challenges, and collectively brainstorm how to #stayrelevant** in the ever-evolving world of R and data science. To make the most of this shared learning, we‚Äôd love to turn our discussion into a **collaborative blog post**. All participants will be invited to join as co-authors.

Please bring your laptop so we can work collaboratively in a shared Google Doc, and come ready to share an example of a time you discovered a new data science tool or approach (and how you first heard about it).

As always, all R-users, from beginners to experts, are welcome!

\~Your R-Ladies SB Co-organizers

title: R-Ladies at R Dev Days with Dr Heather Turner
description:
Rladies Melbourne will be hosting Dr Heather Turner who is a leading R developer and statistician with over two decades of experience.

**R-Ladies at R Dev Days**
Under my research software engineering fellowship "Sustainability and EDI (Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion) in the R Project" I have led the organisation of nine "R Dev Day"s, where R users work collaboratively on contributions to base R and to infrastructure that supports such contribution. Around 150 people have participated in these events, with good representation from groups that have historically been underrepresented in the contributor community, including women and gender minorities.

In this talk, I'll give some insight into the tasks that people have worked on at R Dev Days, highlighting some examples that R-Ladies have been involved in. It's broader than you might think, including translation, dashboards, websites, the contributor guide, and CRAN utilities, as well as the code and documentation of base R. I'll explain different ways to get involved, including joining the upcoming hybrid events at Monash University (https://pretix.eu/r-contributors/r-dev-day-oz-25/) and the University of Auckland (https://pretix.eu/r-contributors/r-dev-day-nz-25/).

**R Dev Day @ Australia 2025 - November 21**
Dr Turner has additionally organised R Dev Day @ Australia 2025. This is an open, collaborative event for people interested in contributing to the code and documentation of base R, or to infrastructure that supports such contribution. Both new and experienced contributors are welcome!

You can choose to join in-person at Monash City Campus, Melbourne, or online.

[Registration](https://pretix.eu/r-contributors/r-dev-day-oz-25/) will remain open until **Sunday November 16, 2025**.

***Register and stay tuned for more details on her presentation and the location for the 12th of November.***

title: Traffic data in plots and maps
description:
Join us for a hands-on, beginner-friendly session where we‚Äôll explore how to create interactive maps in R using Leaflet. We‚Äôll start with a simple dataset, do some quick visualizations with ggplot2, and then build up to a map with interactive popups.
No need to be a mapping expert ‚Äî we‚Äôll code together and experiment as we go. Bring your laptop with R and RStudio installed, and we‚Äôll make some maps!

Note: this event was originally going to be about tidymodels, but we have had to make a change of plans, so the tidymodels workshop will be held at a later time.

title: [In-Person] R-Ladies RTP Social and New R Innovations Discussion
description:
Come meet with other R-Ladies in the RTP area! We will socialize and get to know each other at the Boxyard RTP (https://boxyard.rtp.org/). If you haven‚Äôt been to the Boxyard, think of an outdoor food court or more permanent food trucks - several options for food and drinks.

In addition to socializing, we will talk about what we think are the latest new (cool) innovations emerging from the R coding community. Looking for inspiration? Check out your favorite R developer on social media or there's always RWeekly.org (https://rweekly.org/)!

**The first 30-min will be for informal networking and we'll start introductions and more structured conversation around 6pm ET.**

**Who is this for?**
New and experienced R users alike!

**What should I bring?**
Ideas for future events and money if you would like food or drink.

**Where will it take place?**
Boxyard RTP - we will put out a sign to indicate where our group is.
900 Park Offices Dr, Research Triangle Park, NC 27709

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend as guests and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Developing your data visualisation skills in ggplot2
description: In this session, we'll be working through the process of developing a visualisation in ggplot2. We'll start with a brand new dataset and create some exploratory plots; sketch out some ideas and decide what we want to communicate; build a basic plot in ggplot2; and then refine our chart to create something that's artistic and aesthetic, yet effective. Some basic knowledge of the tidyverse will be helpful, but all of the code in this session will be explained and made available afterwards.

title: C√≥mo ejecutar y personalizar un LLM para tu propio c√≥digo.
description:
Titulo: C√≥mo ejecutar y personalizar un LLM (Modelo de Lenguaje de Gran Tama√±o) para tu propio c√≥digo. Un ejemplo usando Python, React, Postgres y Docker.

En este meetup **h√≠brido** de la mano de Kristin tendremos una sesi√≥n pr√°ctica, donde instalaremos y configuraremos un LLM local en nuestro equipo. Aprender√°s a personalizarlo para comprender tus datos y adaptar sus respuestas a tu flujo de trabajo. Tambi√©n exploraremos c√≥mo integrarlo en aplicaciones como Freyoto, una herramienta de consulta de fotos. Juntos, analizaremos desaf√≠os reales de an√°lisis y exploraremos c√≥mo la combinaci√≥n de LLM con herramientas de software puede generar informaci√≥n m√°s r√°pidamente.

Title: How to run and customize an LLM (Large Language Model) for your own code with an example using Python, React, Postgres, and Docker.
In this hands-on session, we‚Äôll install and configure a local LLM on your own machine. You‚Äôll learn how to customize it to understand your data and tailor its responses to your workflow. We‚Äôll also explore how to integrate it into applications like Freyoto, a photo-querying tool. Together, we‚Äôll discuss real analysis challenges and explore how combining LLMs with software tooling can lead to faster insights.

El taller ser√° **h√≠brido** y se realizar√° el **martes 4 de noviembre de 10:30 hs a 12:30 hs** en el edificio de INIBIOMA, sala seminarios (Pasaje Gutierrez 1400, Primer piso, Bariloche).

title: Workshop - Introduction to R
description:
After a summer break, we are kickstarting our events again with an introductory workshop on the **R** programming language. No previous knowledge of **R** is required, and we welcome all genders and identities to attend our events at R-Ladies Vienna.

**‚ÑπÔ∏è Abstract**
**R** is a powerful programming language and environment widely used across fields from statistics and economics to psychology, biology, and more. It also provides a versatile analytical toolkit for business analysts and professionals working with data.

The goal of this workshop is for our attendees to become acquainted with R to start their data analytics journey. Within this 1.5-hour workshop, we will cover:

* R as a calculator
* Basic data types and structures
* Reading data into R and exporting for external purposes
* Basic data processing
* Basic data visualization
* Loops, functions, and conditional statements

**üí° What to prepare**

* Before the workshop, install **R** and **RStudio** on your laptop by following the 2-step guide at [https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)
* On the workshop day, **bring your own laptop** to follow the workshop material closely and code along with us!

**‚è±Ô∏è Duration**
The workshop will last approximately 1.5 hours. Doors open at 17:45.

**üó∫Ô∏è Location**
Seminar Room DA green 03A / Sem.R. DA gr√ºn 03 A
(DA03A15)
3rd floor, green area
TU Wien Freihaus ([map](https://maps.app.goo.gl/N8PSCZfdi97KirFY6))
Wiedner Hauptstra√üe 8-10, 1040 Vienna

**üìç How to find us**
In the green area of TU Wien Freihaus, take the lift to the 3rd floor. After exiting the lift, you will see the seminar room on your right.
Use this [floor plan](https://maps.tuwien.ac.at/?q=DA04E10) to help locate the room.

title: Efficient File Management in R with {fs}
description: Join us for a hands-on workshop using the **{fs}** package to easily bring order to messy file systems. Through practical examples, you‚Äôll learn to automate common tasks like creating, renaming, moving, and deleting files and directories. Together, we‚Äôll transform a cluttered folder filled with mixed-case filenames and inconsistent delimiters into a clean, organized structure. By the end, you‚Äôll have practical, reusable tools to streamline file management in your own projects.

title: Open Lecture - Topic: Basics of Graph Theory and NetworkX in Python
description:
*Open Lecture - Special Session of the ‚ÄúFrom 0 to Hero‚Äù Series*
Topic: **Basics of Graph Theory and NetworkX in Python**

üë©‚Äçüè´ Speaker: **Silva Bashllari**
Data Scientist ‚Ä¢ Researcher ‚Ä¢ Tech Community Builder

Data Science goes far beyond Machine Learning, and Graph Theory is a powerful example of that. In this open lecture, we will explore how graphs can be used to model complex systems such as social networks, transportation routes, communication infrastructures, and even the spread of misinformation online.

We will connect Graph Theory with Linear Algebra and demonstrate how key concepts are interpreted through mathematical structures. All theoretical concepts will be brought to life through hands-on modeling in Python using the NetworkX library for network analysis and graph visualization.

üìç Location: University Metropolitan Tirana, Building 3, Auditorium A2
üìÖ Date: 29.10.2025
üï¶ Time: 11:30 ‚Äì 13:00

We look forward to your participation, don‚Äôt miss it!

title: R package development with GitHub Pages and pkgdown
description:
Creating clear, professional documentation is key to making your R package useful to other people, but building a documentation website can be tricky. The [`pkgdown`](https://pkgdown.r-lib.org/) package makes this process much easier, but deploying via GitHub Pages can present its own set of challenges.

In this workshop, we‚Äôll build a simple R package together, and use GitHub Actions and GitHub Pages to create a `pkgdown` documentation website for the package. By the end of this workshop, you‚Äôll have:

* üåé A toy R package available on GitHub for others to install
* üìÑ A `pkgdown` website for your package, deployed via GitHub Pages

**Before the workshop participants should:**

* Create a [GitHub account](https://github.com). Note that prior experience with package development and/or GitHub is not required.
* Download and install R, Positron, and Git on their personal PCs.
* If you have trouble with the above we are able to provide access to the Posit Cloud environment as a backup.

**At the workshop participants should:**

* Bring your own PC.
* Be willing to learn and contribute to a safe and welcoming environment.

**This is an in-person event with limited space! Please only RSVP if you are able to attend in-person!**

**\*\*\*Please note that the mission of R-Ladies is to increase gender diversity in the R community. This event is intended to provide a safe space for women and gender minorities. We ask for male allies to be invited by and accompanied by a woman or gender minority.\*\*\***

title: Lunch & Learn with Alex Velez: From data to story
description: The typical graph in a business communication often leaves our audience confused and overwhelmed. In this session, you‚Äôll be walked through an illustration of how to avoid analysis paralysis by turning a regular business graph into an effective visual narrative. Attendees will leave with an enhanced appreciation for the power of data storytelling and practical tips they can implement immediately to achieve greater impact when communicating in a data-driven way.

description:
October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month ‚Äî a time to raise awareness, honour the millions of lives impacted by breast cancer, and reaffirm our global commitment to equitable access to care and improved survival for all.
This webinar, ‚ÄúCoding Against Cancer: Using R to Detect Breast Cancer from Anthropometric Data,‚Äù brings together the worlds of data science and public health to demonstrate how coding can contribute to early detection and better health outcomes.

title: BNPL and Machine Learning: Decisions That Scale
description:
In this presentation, we‚Äôll explore how machine learning models are transforming decision-making in the BNPL (Buy Now, Pay Later) landscape. Focusing on credit scoring, we‚Äôll discuss the unique challenges of this audience‚Äîsuch as lack of credit history, short-term behavior, and high volatility‚Äîand how predictive techniques can deliver fast, scalable, and accurate responses.
The talk will cover everything from feature engineering to performance evaluation in dynamic environments, while also addressing ethical considerations and financial inclusion. By the end, participants will gain a clear understanding of how data and algorithms can drive smarter, safer decisions in instant credit.

title: Positron for RStudio Users: A Gentle Introduction
description:
Curious about Positron, the new open-source data science IDE from Posit? This session will walk RStudio users through the basics of Positron, highlight familiar features, and show what‚Äôs new.
Whether you‚Äôre exploring it for the first time or considering a switch, you‚Äôll leave with a clear sense of how Positron can fit into your workflow.

title: NASA Space Apps 2025 in Zurich
description:
NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025 ‚Äì Zurich second year edition.

For the second time, after succesful event in 2024, and more than 10 projects submitted locally, Switzerland in Zurich again will host the NASA Space Apps Challenge, where innovators, developers, scientists, designers, students, and creatives come together to solve real challenges on Earth and in space using open data from NASA and partner space agencies.
Date: October 4‚Äì5, 2025
Location: Zurich (offline & online participation possible) Global Theme: *Solving for Earth with Space*

### What is Space Apps?

NASA Space Apps is a 48-hour global hackathon that engages tens of thousands of participants across 150+ countries. Teams work on challenges covering areas such as:

* Earth observation & climate action
* Space exploration & robotics
* AI, data & technology for science
* Human health & future of life in space

Whether you‚Äôre a coder, designer, engineer, storyteller, or space enthusiast, you‚Äôll find a challenge where your skills make a difference.

### Why Join in Zurich?

* Be part of the first-ever Zurich edition
* Connect with a global community of innovators
* Collaborate in interdisciplinary teams
* Access NASA‚Äôs open data and resources
* Win local prizes & compete for global recognition by NASA

### Who Can Join?

Everyone is welcome ‚Äî from high school students to professionals, beginners to experts. No previous space or coding experience required ‚Äî just curiosity, creativity, and teamwork!

**How to Register**

1. Click Register and create account at the platform www.spaceappschallenge.org
2. Chose Zurich location and fill small form there https://linkly.link/2E8Px Closer to the date, you‚Äôll receive access to the official NASA Space Apps platform to select challenges and form teams.
3. After that you are all set for the hackathon!

Let‚Äôs solve for Earth and space ‚Äî together in Zurich!

Learn more about the global program:
www.spaceappschallenge.org

Venue update. The hackathon will be in Community event space, final awards at the big Conference hall. Registration for the hackathon at the official website, please create account and choose Zurich as your location :https://linkly.link/2E8Px. Registration is mandatory

title: Nuevo Meetup R-Ladies Bariloche: Let's talk!
description:
¬°¬°¬°ATENCION!!!!
Tenemos el agrado de invitarlas a la presentaci√≥n y discusi√≥n de una publicaci√≥n reciente del grupo de R-Ladies Bariloche en el n√∫mero especial de Ecolog√≠a Austral: [La dimensi√≥n de g√©nero en la ecolog√≠a: visiones desde la diversidad de enfoques](https://ojs.ecologiaaustral.com.ar/index.php/Ecologia_Austral/announcement/view/11)
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
El art√≠culo, producto de nuestra historia compartida con ustedes y otras R-Ladies del mundo, se titula ***Valores compartidos en la comunidad R-Ladies: Hacia la construcci√≥n de un liderazgo alternativo al propuesto por el modelo patriarcal***

Queremos invitarlas a discutir el art√≠culo en comunidad para seguir pensando otras formas de liderar, desde nuestros valores, experiencias y objetivos de vida.

Resumen del art√≠culo:
"A√∫n existe una brecha de g√©nero importante en muchas √°reas del conocimiento, incluyendo la ecolog√≠a. Si bien hoy existen m√°s oportunidades de liderazgo que antes para los g√©neros subrepresentados, √©stas ‚Äîfrecuentemente vinculadas a contextos masculinizados, verticalistas y centrados en la productividad y el poder‚Äî fuerzan a las personas a desistir de ocupar dichos roles o bien a reproducir la misma din√°mica asumiendo grandes costos personales. As√≠, existe la necesidad urgente de crear oportunidades de liderazgo ‚Äîdistintas a aquellas que nos ofrece el modelo capitalista patriarcal‚Äî para que los g√©neros subrepresentados puedan desarrollar sus capacidades, compartir saberes y ser motores de cambio hacia un ambiente acad√©mico-cient√≠fico creativo, reflexivo e inclusivo. Para esto es clave poner en valor las experiencias que surgen de espacios cuyo objetivo es crear √°mbitos de crecimiento respetuosos y justos. R-Ladies, es una red global colaborativa que busca promover la diversidad de g√©neros en el √°mbito de la programaci√≥n en el software libre R, alentando y apoyando a los g√©neros subrepresentados (mujeres cis/trans, varones trans, no binaries, etc.) para que alcancen su m√°ximo potencial en programaci√≥n. Realizamos una encuesta dentro comunidad de la comunidad de R-Ladies para recuperar valores, experiencias y estrategias para construir nuevos modelos de liderazgo. Como valores fundamentales para un modelo de liderazgo alternativo identificamos la capacidad de: 1) escuchar, empatizar y valorar a cada persona integrante del equipo independientemente de su posici√≥n o trayectoria; 2) acompa√±ar e incentivar a otres a alcanzar sus objetivos, y 3) liderar desde el respeto, la inclusi√≥n y la diversidad. Creemos imprescindible la formaci√≥n en perspectiva de g√©nero de las personas que ocupan posiciones de liderazgo y la no precarizaci√≥n del trabajo de les otres. Las redes que fomentan la participaci√≥n de g√©neros subrepresentados, como R-Ladies, ofrecen una comunidad y promueven un espacio seguro y respetuoso para el aprendizaje."

El encuentro ser√° presencial y se realizar√° el **jueves 2 de octubre de 11 hs a 12 hs en el edificio de INIBIOMA, sala de seminarios (Pasaje Guti√©rrez 1400, Bariloche).**

Est√° vez no hace falta tener conocimiento de R, pero s√≠ el art√≠culo le√≠do ([acceder al art√≠culo](https://ojs.ecologiaaustral.com.ar/index.php/Ecologia_Austral/article/view/2474)) y acordar con el [C√≥digo de conducta](https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md#spanish) que es necesario aceptar a partir del link.

A quienes asistan, recuerden traer su taza/mate y si quieren, algo para compartir!!

¬°Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no s√≥lo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electr√≥nico) para poder recibir notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

Por cualquier consulta bariloche@rladies.org.
Organizaci√≥n R-ladies BRC

title: Using Python Within Stata
description:
üêç‚ú® **This time it‚Äôs Python time‚Ä¶ inside Stata!**
Discover how to unlock new possibilities by combining two powerful tools in one workflow.

**Python** is an increasingly popular programming language that can be used for many statistical and nonstatistical applications. **Stata** provides a bidirectional connection with Python using the **Stata Function Interface (SFI)**.

This talk will demonstrate **how to use Python interactively within Stata**, how to execute Python scripts within Stata, how to use Python in Stata do-files, and how to integrate Python into Stata commands and .ado files.

No prior experience with Python is necessary.

Transform your static R plots into interactive, engaging visual stories! In this hands-on workshop, we‚Äôll take pre-organised ggplot2 code and show you how to enhance it with **ggplotly**, making your data come alive for presentations, dashboards, and reports.

Through practical **case studies**, you‚Äôll explore a variety of visualisations, learn **why certain methods are best for different data types**, and see **how interactive features can add depth and clarity** to your insights.

title: R package creation made easy: Functions!
description:
Do you want to learn how to develop R packages from scratch? This R-Ladies Cologne series is just for you! Together, we‚Äôll walk through **every step of package development**, from writing your first function to submitting your package to CRAN.

To launch this series, our guest S√©bastien Rochette introduced his package **{fusen}**, which turns R Markdown files into fully functional R packages. You can watch the first workshop here: https://youtu.be/wAkZvwPK1P4?si=w_dYxTwhLKRxGtzz

In this second meeting, the R-Ladies Cologne team is organizing a hands-on workshop on functions - the building blocks of packages!

We will teach you:

* How do functions work?
* What are dependencies, and how to address them?
* How to document your functions with Roxygen?

You will then collaborate in teams to build functions for a real package that will be submitted to CRAN in the final meeting of this series. It does not matter if you are a beginner or experienced R user, this workshop series welcomes all!

**When?**
üìÖ Date: 29.08.2025

title: [DRAFT] Introduction to building Shiny Apps with {RHINO}
description:
Ready to take your Shiny skills to the next level? Join us for an interactive workshop on building modern, production-grade Shiny applications with the {rhino} framework.

In this practical session, you‚Äôll learn how to:

* Explore the structure and features of a real-world {rhino}-built Shiny app
* Follow a step-by-step, hands-on tutorial to create your own {rhino} app
* Use AI-powered development to rapidly design and build a Shiny module

Whether you‚Äôre just starting with {rhino} or already familiar with Shiny, you‚Äôll leave with actionable knowledge, reusable code, and the confidence to apply these techniques to your own projects.

**Speaker: Rory Chen**

Rory Chen is a health data scientist specialising in the data infrastructure that supports dementia research. She leads CHeBA‚Äôs Dementias Platform Australia initiative, advancing the FAIR data principles ‚Äî making research data more **Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable**.

With over nine years‚Äô experience working with large, complex datasets in academic and public health settings, Rory brings expertise in R, Python, SAS, SQL, REDCap, AWS, and agile project management. She is also an active member of R-Ladies Sydney and the UNSW CodeRs Committee.

title: Topic Modeling: Turning Conversation into Strategy
description:
Imagine you are a Data Scientist working for a global e-commerce giant. Every day, millions of customers leave feedback‚Äîranging from product reviews to support chat transcripts‚Äîcovering everything from delivery delays to product quality concerns. These comments, written in natural language, pile up into hundreds of thousands of unstructured records each month. Your task is to sift through this vast sea of text, uncover the most common themes, spot emerging issues, and share actionable recommendations with marketing, operations, and product teams‚Äîdecisions that could directly shape customer satisfaction and business growth.
This type of real-world challenge highlights the power of cutting-edge techniques like topic modeling. This tool transforms raw conversation into strategic insight, turning scattered voices into a clear, data-driven direction.
Topic Modeling: Turning Conversation into Strategy explores how unstructured text‚Äîsuch as customer feedback, social media discussions, call center transcripts, or survey responses‚Äîcan be analyzed to reveal recurring themes and priorities. By applying algorithms like Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) organizations can detect trends, identify pain points, and prioritize actions.
This process bridges the gap between what people are saying and what an organization needs to do, ensuring that decisions are informed by evidence rather than guesswork.

description:

title: Interactive Quarto Dashboards
description:
In this easy-going workshop, we will be building interactive website dashboards that allow teams to quickly show each other information such as numerous graphs and tables.

This tool is useful for academic research groups, business teams, or other people who meet regularly for updates. We will learn how to filter, sort, visualize data, uncover trends, and present results aesthetically.

This workshop will use the R programming language and will include some exploration in Quarto, dashboards, Shiny, markdown, and geospatial data. Some computer programming experience is preferred, but expertise is not required.

title: [ONLINE] Tidymodels Summer Bookclub #5 (Rescheduled)
description:
Interested in learning more about the tidymodels framework in R, but not sure where to start? Looking for some fun summer reading (and coding)? title: Workshops for Ukraine - How to Use R with Excel (cross-posting)
description:

title: From Maps to Insights: Geospatial Hotspot Analysis in R
description:
**Are you a public health professional, data analyst, student, or researcher eager to unlock the power of location-based insights?**

Join us for this hands-on training designed to equip you with practical skills in geospatial data analysis using R.
Using real-world data, you‚Äôll learn how to import and visualize shapefiles, merge health data, perform spatial clustering analysis, and detect disease hotspots using Local Indicators of Spatial Association (LISA).
This training will guide you ***step-by-step*** ***from raw data to meaningful maps and spatial statistics that can inform health interventions and decision-making***.
üìç Learn. Map. Analyze. Interpret.
**No prior GIS experience required, just a passion for learning!**

title: Using Git for Version Control and Collaboration
description:
Do you have trouble keeping track of changes in your code? Have you ever had to collaborate on a project with others and had to send files back and forth tediously? **Git** will be your best friend to solve these problems and many more!

This presentation will give you an introduction to **Git**, the basics of how to use it, and some of its very helpful applications such as collaboration and code reproducibility. The focus will be on the use of Git in conjunction with Github (yes, these are two separate things!). This will help you to effectively use one of the most powerful tools available to you and give you more confidence to code freely without fear.

**There‚Äôll also be food, drinks, and plenty of time to network with fellow attendees!**

title: Forecasting Time Series with Linear Regression: A Feature-Driven Approach
description:
Curious about time series forecasting but not sure where to start?

Join us for a beginner-friendly workshop exploring how linear regression can be used for time series forecasting.

This talk explores ***the fundamentals of time series forecasting using linear regression models***. We‚Äôll cover how to transform time series data into a supervised learning format and utilize feature engineering techniques to model various components of the series, including trends, seasons, outliers, and structural breaks.

No prior time series experience is required‚Äîjust a basic understanding of regression and a desire to learn.

üß† **What you‚Äôll learn:**

* How to frame time series as a regression problem
* Feature engineering techniques for time-aware data
* Modeling trend, seasonality, outliers, and breaks
* Practical tips for evaluation and validation

Whether you‚Äôre brushing up on regression or starting your forecasting journey, this workshop will provide hands-on insights in an accessible way.

title: From Code to Crisis Response: Using R for Real-World Impact [ONLINE]
description:
Please join us for an online meetup with [Kelly Charniga](https://bsky.app/profile/kcharniga.bsky.social) on applying R to public health challenges while serving as a Prevention Effectiveness Fellow at the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

**Topic:** As a Prevention Effectiveness Fellow at the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Kelly had the opportunity to apply R to interesting public health challenges. In this talk, she'll share two projects that show how R moves beyond academic exercises into work that directly impacts public health.
First, she'll walk through how she used existing R packages to model mpox transmission potential ahead of the 2022 global outbreak. You'll see the practical side of epidemiological modelling‚Äîthe packages she relied on, the data challenges she faced, and how the results foreshadowed the current mpox epidemic in Africa.
Next, she'll discuss developing an RShiny app for rabies risk assessments that's now being used across the U.S. She'll share the development process, from initial concept to deployment, including the lessons learned about building tools for non-technical end users.
Whether you're curious about public health applications of R, interested in Shiny development, or wondering how your R skills might translate to government work, this talk will give you concrete examples and practical insights you can apply to your own projects.

**Disclaimer:** Kelly is not a current CDC employee and speaks in a personal capacity. Her views are her own and do not represent the CDC or the US Government.

**Prerequisites:** There are no prerequisites. All members are encouraged to attend.

**Code of Conduct:** R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. For more information, see the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/coc/).

title: Lunch&Learn with Ella Kaye: C for R users
description:
Much of base R is written in C. As R users, we may encounter this code when debugging our own code. As R contributors, we may wish to propose patches to the C code if we discover a bug. In any case, learning a new language can be fun and rewarding!
In this talk, I'll discuss why, as R users/programmers, we may want to learn C, and resources for doing so. I'll show examples of how C is used in the codebase of base R. I'll give an example of how, with only a little C knowledge, it was possible to add a new feature into the language (specifying colours with three-digit hex codes). Finally, I‚Äôll discuss various initiatives from the R Contribution Working Group and show how you, too, can get involved in contributing to base R.

title: LLM Tools in the R space
description:
This talk is inspired by Luis's book on LLMs in R, https://luisdva.github.io/llmsr-book/.
The rapidly growing number of packages for leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) in R, along with their corresponding learning resources, reflects the active and collaborative nature of the R community. This talk will introduce new LLM-based tools for R and their potential uses, and provide an overview of the online guide that Luis compiled and maintains to keep track of this highly dynamic space.

description:
Interested in learning more about the tidymodels framework in R, but not sure where to start? Looking for some fun summer reading (and coding)? This will be the second a four part summer bookclub series where we'll read through a handful of chapters in the Tidy Models with R book ([https://www.tmwr.org/](https://www.tmwr.org/)) on our own and then meet to discuss what we liked, learned, and want to know more about. 4\. The Ames Housing Data
5\. Spending our Data
6\. Fitting Models with parsnip

Who is this for?
For this bookclub series it will be helpful if you have a basic understanding of coding in R. That said, this event is all about supporting folks and learning together! All R-Ladies are welcome - including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. If you're a note taker, your notes and questions from reading through the chapters are also a must have!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Speaking Many Languages: Finding Power and Joy in R and Python
description:
**Join us for a special [PyData](https://www.meetup.com/it-IT/pydata-roma-capitale/) x [R-Ladies](rladiesrome.org) x [Rome R Users Group](https://www.meetup.com/rome-r-users-group/events/308302187)** **EVENT!**

**IN PERSON at Istituto Nazionale di Geofisica e Vulcanologia -** **[INGV.IT](ingv.it)**
**Registration for in person**: **[https://www.meetup.com/pydata-roma-capitale/events/308302003](https://www.meetup.com/pydata-roma-capitale/events/308302003)**
‚ö†Ô∏è Remember to RSVP using your **full name** for security reasons and bring a **valid ID** to show at the entrance. **Otherwise, you will not be allowed to enter the premises!** ‚ö†Ô∏è

**ONLINE Attendees can use the zoom link on this page.**

We‚Äôll kick off the day with a warm welcome from [R-Ladies](rladiesrome.org) & [Rome R Users](https://www.meetup.com/rome-r-users-group/) communities, followed by an inspiring opening talk and a series of dynamic 5-minute **lightning talks** from community members. Whether you‚Äôre joining in person or tuning in remotely, we‚Äôre excited to celebrate the power of open-source languages, data science, and community.

Schedule:

* 18:00 üö™ Doors open
* 18:15 üôå Welcome from PyData Roma Capitale, R-Ladies Rome, and R User Group
* 18.30 üé§ **"Speaking Many Languages: Finding Power and Joy in R and Python" ‚Äì Federica Gazzelloni**
* 19.00 ‚ö° **Lightning Talks** (open mic, up to 5 minutes!)
* 19.30 ü§ù Networking ‚Äîshare insights, spark new collaborations
* 20:00 üëã Close & goodnight (or if you want, join us for a multi-community dinner outside the venue!)

**Opening Talk ‚Äì Speaking Many Languages: Finding Power and Joy in R and Python**
*By Federica Gazzelloni*
When I first started my journey in data science, I believed I had to ‚Äúchoose a side‚Äù‚ÄîR or Python. But over time, I discovered that speaking more than one programming language isn‚Äôt about choosing sides; it‚Äôs about expanding perspectives. In this talk, I‚Äôll share a bit of my personal story‚Äîhow I came to learn both R and Python, what each has taught me, and how switching between them has enriched my work and opened unexpected doors. Along the way, I‚Äôll walk through a few simple, side-by-side examples in both languages to highlight their strengths and unique styles. Whether you‚Äôre deeply rooted in one language or just starting out, I hope this talk leaves you feeling empowered to learn broadly, build confidently, and connect across communities.

title: RLadies x PyLadies Vancouver Career Panel
description:
RLadies and PyLadies Vancouver are teaming up to bring you a panel of professionals to discuss career paths and current challenges. Whether you are starting out in your career or a seasoned veteran, the information covered will help you in your career! Bring your questions and notepad!

Here is a sneak peak at some of the questions we will be asking:
-What skills should a new data scientist have if trying to get a job as a data scientist/data engineer/data analyst
-What are some of the most important skills for a data scientist to have on the job?

We will also have dedicated time for the audience to ask questions as well.

**Panelist Profiles:**
*Momoko Ueda*
Momoko Ueda, PhD is the Founding Data Scientist at Taskmole, where she uses Python, machine learning and large language models to discover and automate repetitive workflows. She holds a PhD in Criminology with a focus on forensic science, and previously worked at a startup focused on threat and misinformation detection on social media. She‚Äôs also the Co-founder of HirePhD Career Society, a nonprofit that built a global community of 6,000+ PhDs to support their transition into industry.

*Shannon Lo*
Shannon is a data professional who has worked in various industries including telecom, retail, and public health. Her current work involves topic-specific analyses on the Canadian Coroner and Medical Examiner Database. When she's not geeking out about data, you can usually find her hiking, climbing, or camping.

*Kathryn Morrison*
Kathryn Morrison is a statistician and the founder of Precision Analytics, a boutique firm specializing in health data science. She has over a decade of experience applying statistical methods in industry, such as health technology assessment and real-world evidence projects. Kathryn works primarily in R, developing custom analytics pipelines, statistical models, and reproducible workflows for clients ranging from pharmaceutical companies to research institutes. She also serves on committees for the Statistical Society of Canada and co-organizes the R-Ladies Montreal chapter.

More to come!

***

1. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct
2. Who is this allowed to attend the event?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming language in data science, which is R.
3. To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

See you there!

Jasmine, Melissa and Mariatta

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group (on a Thursday)
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

At this event, we'll revisit one of the Tidy Tuesday datasets from January 2025 on the US Census Bureau water insecurity data (yes, let's try to do some spatial mapping!). You can read more about it here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2025/2025-01-28/readme.md and see some previous analysis of the data by folks at the US Geological Survey here: https://waterdata.usgs.gov/blog/acs-maps/.

Agenda (all times in ET):
6:00 - 6:15 pm Meet & Greet
6:15 - 7:15 pm #tidytuesday
7:15 - 7:30 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out [this blog post](https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt) and [the main repository page](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday).

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Scrollytelling Science with Quarto and Closeread [ONLINE]
description:
Please join us for an online meetup with [Cecilia Baldoni](https://bsky.app/profile/cecibaldoni.bsky.social) on Scrollytelling science with [Quarto](https://quarto.org/) and [Closeread](https://closeread.dev/).

**Topic:** If you enjoy building things with R and Markdown, scrollytelling might be your next favorite tool!
In this talk, Cecilia will show how she used Quarto and its Closeread format to build an interactive scrollytelling website that presents her research on brain plasticity in shrews. She will walk through the structure of a Closeread project, show how R-generated plots can be integrated, and share layout tips, and common pitfalls. This session is a hands-on look at turning any topic into a compelling visual story using tools many R users already know.

**Prerequisites:** There are no prerequisites. All members are encouraged to attend.

**Code of Conduct:** R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. For more information, see the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/coc/).

title: R in Industry: Biopharmaceutical Process Optimization through Advanced DoE
description:
In our May 2025 meetup, we explore the interdisciplinary application of data science in the biopharmaceutical industry. Christina Yassouridis, Senior Data Scientist from Boehringer Ingelheim, will share with us how she designs and develops an R package which applies Design of Experiment (DoE) approaches to optimize biopharmaceutical manufacturing process.

Expect to hear about:
üü° **Data science:** Theoretical background of advanced Design of Experiments (DoE) approach using Halton designs and Latin Hypercube Designs
üü£ **R programming:** The design and development of R package to meet industry needs
üü¢ **Biopharmaceutical industry:** Current industry applications of R package in solving optimization problems

It will be an interesting sharing to see how R is applied to solve real-world problems in biopharmaceutical manufacturing, an area closely connected to our well-being. The theoretical background of the DoE approaches involved will also be introduced, which allows R users without field knowledge to follow along.

R-Ladies Vienna promotes gender diversity in the R community. **All genders and skill levels in R are welcome to our events.** We look forward to seeing you!

**üó£Ô∏è Speaker**
Christina is currently a Senior Data Scientist at Boehringer Ingelheim, one of the world‚Äôs largest pharmaceutical companies. With a PhD in Applied Statistics, Christina has extensive experience as a data science professional in both industry and consulting, and as a researcher at BOKU.

**‚ÑπÔ∏è Abstract**
Biopharmaceutical manufacturing encompasses complex processes involving living organisms and multiple interacting steps. To optimize these processes, data scientists develop digital representations using machine learning models to identify optimal process parameters across multidimensional experimental spaces. For Gaussian process regression models, evenly distributed experimental points yield superior results.

The R package {spacefillngDoEs}, developed by Christina, integrates and extends two established approaches:

1. **Halton designs:** These low-discrepancy sequences enable efficient quasi-Monte Carlo methods for numerical integration and sampling in high-dimensional spaces.
2. **Latin Hypercube Designs**: This statistical method generates near-random parameter value samples from multidimensional distributions.

By combining functionalities from the R packages {qrng} and {SLHD} while extending their capabilities to handle mixed data types, {spacefillngDoEs} addresses specific industry requirements.

In this presentation, Christina will introduce the theoretical foundations of generalized Halton designs, demonstrate the R package's functionality, and showcase its current industrial application.

**‚è±Ô∏è Duration**
The event will last approximately 1 to 1.5 hours, including a Q&A session. Doors open at 17:45.

**üó∫Ô∏è Location**
Seminar Room DA green 04 / Seminarraum DA gr√ºn 04 (DA04E10)
4th floor, green area
TU Wien Freihaus ([map](https://maps.app.goo.gl/vJYyceLgZHpNasFa9))
Wiedner Hauptstra√üe 8-10, 1040 Wien

**üìç How to find us**
In the green area of TU Wien Freihaus, take the lift to the 4th floor. After exiting the lift, turn left to enter through the green doors, then turn left again. The seminar room will be on your left. Use this [floor plan](https://maps.tuwien.ac.at/?q=DA04E10) to help locate the room.

title: Cross-chapter: TidyTuesday with R-Ladies
description:
Come join us for a **fun session on coding with R and Rstudio**!
R-Ladies Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney are thrilled to host our first ever cross-chapter ***TidyTuesday*** and we would love to have you come along!

TidyTuesday is a weekly event created by the Data Science Learning Community for folks to develop new skills in a low-stakes, welcoming environment. Each week, a new dataset is released for everyone to play and explore. There is no limit to what you can do! You can produce a nice-looking table, or a story-telling graphic, perhaps even an intuitive Shiny interface ‚Äì the choice is yours!

**What to expect:**
Join a follow-along group or work independently on the same dataset for about 30 mins then come together to celebrate each other‚Äôs creations!
*This event is online only. All you need is your laptop!*

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

***Photos, Films and all other media/recordings***\*: This event will not be recorded.\*
***Code of Conduct***\*: R-Ladies Canberra is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.\*
***Community Policies***\*: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Sydney events to be of minority genders.\*

title: Intro to Geospatial Tools in R
description:
Curious about working with spatial data in R? Whether you're just starting out or looking to sharpen your skills and learn about new tools\* this R Ladies meetup is for you!

\*There have been some new packages introduced to work with spatial data in R (sf, terra) in the past few years, and older packages have been phased out (rgdal, raster). This meetup will focus on the new packages, with some helpful comparisons for those who may have learned using the older tools.

**We will cover:**

* An introduction to popular R packages for spatial analysis (like sf, raster, terra, and mapview)
* Tools for static and interactive spatial data visualization in R (tmap, leaflet)
* Live-coding demonstrations of mapping, data wrangling, and spatial visualization
* How R fits into the larger GIS Tools and spatial data visualization ecosystem

**Please bring your laptop with R and R studio installed.**

**üóìÔ∏è Date:** May 5th, 2025
**üïï Time:** 6:00 - 7:00 pm
**üìç Location:** Purple Box @ Entrepreneurs Sandbox, 643 Ilalo Street, Honolulu, HI
(we also hope to have a hybrid option, and will send out a link closer to the date)

Thank you to **Sandbox, HUB and HTDC** for generously sponsoring the space for this meeting!

title: R You Ready? Integrating Large Language Models into your Workflow
description:
We warmly welcome R users of all identities and experience levels to our April meetup, where we explore the methods and use cases of using LLMs directly from R to boost your workflow.

In this meetup, we will:

* Walk through the essential background of modern LLMs (large language models), including their architecture and capabilities
* Dive into the practical ways for harnessing the power of LLMs directly within R
* Explore the growing ecosystem of R packages and APIs connecting to leading LLMs, demonstrating concrete use cases.

We look forward to seeing you at the meetup, where we foster a safe and inclusive space for knowledge exchange.

title: From R to Python: A Gentle Introduction
description:
Are you curious about Python and not sure where to start? Join R-Ladies Rome for a welcoming, hands-on introduction to Python programming. This event is perfect for beginners‚Äîno previous experience required!

We‚Äôll explore how Python works, write simple code together, and show you how it can be used for data analysis and more. Whether you already use R or are completely new to coding, this session is a great place to start learning Python in a supportive and inclusive environment.

Come with your questions, bring your curiosity, and let‚Äôs learn together!

title: Exploring RLanguage for High School Innovators ( postponed for few days)
description: High school innovators who are keen to discover the potential of data analysis and visualization are the target audience for this one-day session on R programming. The fundamentals of R will be taught to participants, along with how to execute basic mathematical operations like addition and subtraction. Additionally, they will gain practical experience utilizing the well-known ggplot2 toolkit to visualize data and create data frames. Students will be guided through the process of developing their own data sets (such the number of attendees) and transforming them into interesting, educational visualizations during the class.

title: Git and GitHub for R Users
description:

Contents

* Understand why version control is necessary and useful.
* Be able to collaborate on code using Git and GitHub from RStudio.
* Edit code, track changes, and review code using GitHub.

Target Audience

* You‚Äôre (reasonably) comfortable writing R code to do some analysis but‚Ä¶
* Your scripts are getting longer and longer
* There are R scripts everywhere
* You don‚Äôt want other people to see the code you‚Äôve written because it‚Äôs all a bit of a mess!
* You don‚Äôt have any experience of Git or GitHub but you‚Äôd like to get started.

Prerequisites

* Basic knowledge of R (including know what R projects are) and RStudio.

Zoom link will be provided closer to the event.

title: R Ladies Fort Collins - Meet and Greet!
description:
Join us for the inaugural meeting of R-Ladies Fort Collins! During this meet and greet, the organizers will introduce themselves and share the mission of R-Ladies, followed by some fun and casual networking activities. We're eager to learn about your interests, what you hope to gain from this community, and gather ideas for future events that meet the community's needs and interests.

This event is free and open to the public, up to the RSVP limit, and we welcome all levels of R software practitioners. Whether you're a seasoned professional or just R curious, we hope to provide networking and educational opportunities to all. Don't miss the chance to join a supportive community dedicated to promoting gender diversity in the R community.

This event will be held at Horse & Dragon Brewing Company, where non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages are available. Attendees are responsible for their own tab. The organizers will be heading to Illegal Pete's after the event for anyone that wishes to join us for a casual dinner.

Whether you are a beginner or an experienced R user, this meeting will help you find cool ways to use R. Don't miss this opportunity to expand your knowledge and network with fellow R enthusiasts.

title: Reproducible analysis pipelines with targets
description:
**Join Us for a Special Event with Olivia Angelin-Bonnet!**

We are thrilled to welcome ***Olivia Angelin-Bonnet***, a statistical scientist at The New Zealand Institute for Plant and Food Research Limited.
She is a real-world practitioner focusing on data analysis and a professional plot-maker. She is passionate about Systems Biology, ‚Äòomics data analysis and integration, and the study of biological networks from a statistical and computational perspective.

**Topic:**

Data science projects typically consist of complex, multi-step analyses, which leads to the development of multiple interdependent scripts, often involving intensive computations, and requiring manual execution. Ensuring reproducibility is crucial, not only for transparency and collaboration, but also for adapting to changes in input data and stakeholder feedback. In this talk, ***Olivia*** will show how to use the targets R package to turn analysis scripts into reproducible pipelines. By automatically tracking dependencies between the analysis steps, caching intermediate results, and detecting changes in data or code, targets streamlines code execution and ensures consistency between inputs, computations, and outputs. Attendees will learn how to integrate targets into their projects to improve the efficiency, reproducibility, and maintainability of their code.

We look forward to seeing you online or in-person :)

***R-Ladies Sydney organisers***
*Find us on [Bluesky Social](https://bsky.app/profile/rladiessydney.bsky.social) and on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/groups/14405806/) for more information on news, presentations and code!*

title: Data Challenge 2025
description:
RLadies Ottawa invites you to our third annual data hackathon to celebrate International Women's day!

At our `posit::conf(2024)` watch party we watched [‚ÄúGitHub: How To Tell Your Professional Story‚Äù by Abigail Haddad](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R-bPjavai5A&list=PL9HYL-VRX0oSFkdF4fJeY63eGDvgofcbn&index=21). In this presentation Haddad highlighted the importance of building a compelling portfolio that not only highlights your skills but explains your professional identity.

For this year‚Äôs data challenge we encourage you to find YOUR passion project to round out your portfolio and develop your professional story! Take a look at your GitHub profile and ask yourself, *what type of project is missing here*?

For example, if you participated in [last year‚Äôs challenge](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd.html#submissions) and created a traditional plot of some sort, this year try creating a visualization using a table, dashboard or another-outside-the-box presentation tool.

You can find the [full details](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2025/iwd.html) on our website.

For more inspo, be sure to check out our upcoming in-person event [Coding for a Cause](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-ottawa/events/306232274/?eventOrigin=group_upcoming_events) with Claudie Larouche on March 18th.

**Guidelines**

Although this challenge is hosted by *R-Ladies* Ottawa, you don‚Äôt have to use R to participate. You could use R, Python, a combination of the two, or anything you‚Äôre comfortable with!

No previous programming experience is required! If you‚Äôre interested in participating, but aren‚Äôt sure where to start, check out the recordings from our [Introduction to R workshops](https://rladies-ottawa.gitub.io/events/2024/intro_to_r.html) that we hosted in early 2024. The workshops will give you a solid foundation in data analysis and data visualization using R.

While anyone is welcome to participate in the challenge and submit an entry, **only submissions by women and gender minorities who reside in Canada will be eligible for the prizes.**

You can participate individually, or in teams of up to 5 people!

The most creative submission, chosen by the organizing team, will receive a $25 virtual gift card to [Maker House,](https://makerhouse.com/) generously donated by them. Maker House offers a curated collection of gifts and homewares, crafted locally in Ottawa and Canada üçÅ

**How to submit an entry**

This will be a month-long data challenge, and you‚Äôll have until **April 4th** to submit your entry. Your submission can be in any form you like ‚Äì it can be a Quarto document, an image, a link to a webpage, or a link to a video, for example.

There are two options for submitting an entry:

* Option 1 (preferred option): If you have experience with GitHub and Quarto, you can create a pull request on [this repository](https://github.com/RLadies-Ottawa/rladies-ottawa.github.io) and add your submission to the [‚ÄúSubmissions‚Äù](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd.html#submissions) part of [this page](https://github.com/RLadies-Ottawa/RLadies-Ottawa.github.io/blob/main/events/2025/iwd.qmd)
* Option 2: If you don‚Äôt have experience with GitHub, you can email [ottawa@rladies.org](mailto:ottawa@rladies.org) a link to your submission materials and we will add the link to our website.

After the submission deadline, R-Ladies Ottawa will host a virtual event where participants can showcase their work. This is a great way to learn from one another and to connect with other like-minded individuals!

The date and time of the showcase event will be announced soon.

title: PGEforge: Towards an open analysis ecosystem for Plasmodium genomic epidemiology
description:
**\*\*UPDATE: THIS EVENT HAS BEEN RESCHEDULED from 27th Mar to 03 Apr\*\***

Major advances in sequencing technologies, bioinformatics pipelines, and data analysis tools have transformed our ability to study malaria transmission and parasite evolution, providing valuable insights into malaria epidemiology from parasite genomic data. However, translating this genomic data into actionable insights for national malaria control programs remains a challenge. Many existing tools lack standardized workflows, comprehensive documentation, or interoperability, making it difficult for researchers and decision-makers to extract meaningful information.

To address this, Shazia and her team developed PGEforge (https://mrc-ide.github.io/PGEforge), a centralized, open-access repository for malaria genomic data analysis including analysis workflows, software evaluations, and reproducible tutorials. The Plasmodium Genomic Epidemiology (PlasmoGenEpi) network convened 18 experts to assess existing analysis tools, define key use cases for genomic data, and establish objective criteria for software evaluation. This initiative identified 40 Plasmodium genomic analysis tools with 22 prioritized for evaluation, defined eight key use cases for genomic data, and developed user-friendly reproducible tutorials for ten tools using shared datasets‚Äîall now accessible via PGEforge. Open-access platforms like PGEforge can empower researchers to adopt standardized practices and can help bridge the gap between genomic data generation, downstream analysis, and the effective use of these tools for malaria molecular surveillance towards actionable information for control programs.

In this talk, Shazia will showcase the functionalities of PGEforge, including real-world applications of genomic data use cases and analysis workflows, our approach to reproducible tutorials, and how we built this community-driven resource at a hackathon event using Quarto!

We look forward to seeing you there üíú

title: AI, Actuarial Science, and R: A New Era of Risk Modeling
description:
üîÆ How is AI reshaping actuarial science? How can R help model risk in this evolving landscape?

Join [R-Ladies Rome](https://rladiesrome.org/) for an insightful talk exploring how artificial intelligence and modern statistical techniques are revolutionizing actuarial work. From machine learning applications to ethical considerations, we‚Äôll cover key trends and practical use cases that are shaping the future of risk modeling.

Learn how R‚Äôs powerful libraries and tools are revolutionizing actuarial workflows, enabling actuaries to model risks with greater accuracy and efficiency. Explore the critical need for transparency, fairness, and accountability in AI-driven decisions.

Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned actuary, a data enthusiast, or an R power user, this session will leave you with actionable knowledge and inspiration to lead in an AI-powered future.

title: Ciencia de datos para la memoria: repensando la dictadura desde R
description:
A 49 a√±os del inicio de la √∫ltima dictadura militar en Argentina y en conmemoraci√≥n de las v√≠ctimas del genocidio, proponemos nuevas miradas y m√©todos desde las Ciencias Sociales y el an√°lisis de datos, que posibilitan abordajes novedosos. A trav√©s del uso de la herramienta R y la t√©cnica de Web Scraping, es posible recuperar informaci√≥n y cruzar bases de datos para enriquecer nuestra comprensi√≥n del pasado, tanto desde una perspectiva sociol√≥gica como hist√≥rica.
En este evento, presentaremos un recorrido por los recursos disponibles, como el paquete "Presentes" de R. Adem√°s Manuel Bruccoleri Ochoa nos presentar√° los aportes realizados a ‚ÄúPresentes‚Äù y algunos resultados in√©ditos obtenidos.

title: Science Gong Show in Collaboration with Project Bridge Colorado
description:
We are collaborating with [Project Bridge](https://www.cuanschutz.edu/services/project-bridge) on organizing a **[Gong Show](https://www.cuanschutz.edu/services/project-bridge/events)**.
The Science Gong Show takes place at a public location, usually a brewery or somewhere similar, and people are invited on stage to talk about their research or work without using any jargon. People in the brewhouse are given little cowbells and can ring (gong) whenever they hear a word they do not understand. It is a great exercise and a nice way to practice sci-comm in a low-stakes environment. **Presentation is not required to attend, come out and enjoy this event with your fellow useRs :)**

**SIGN UP [HERE](https://forms.gle/wwpjUSdUZP3QjbzT6) TO PRESENT!!!**

title: Coding for a cause with Claudie (and ChatGPT!)
description:
Join Claudie, a public servant by day, and a tech enthusiast and problem-solver by night, as she shares her experience using Artificial Intelligence for a good cause. In this presentation, Claudie will share her journey of using AI to create user-friendly websites that address real-world challenges. Discover how she developed various online resources, consolidating data from 100s of web pages and significantly improving access to critical free early years services for parents around the city.

This presentation is a call to action for anyone passionate about technology and community service. Claudie will show you how anyone can leverage AI for social good. Whether you're a seasoned developer or a tech-curious individual, Claudie's story will inspire you to think creatively and use technology to solve real-life problems.

So, who's ready to join Claudie in making the world a better place?

We'll be heading over to Bier Markt (156 Sparks St) afterwards as part of the optional networking.

\*\*\*Please note that the mission of R-Ladies is to increase gender diversity in the R community. While this event is open to anyone who wants to join, it is intended to provide a safe space for women and gender minorities. We ask for male allies to be invited by and accompanied by a woman or gender minority.\*\*\*

title: Lunch&Learn: Quarto with brand.yml with Isabella Vel√°squez
description:
Maintaining a consistent brand identity across data science outputs is essential for clear communication and a professional image. This talk introduces brand.yml, a powerful new tool designed to streamline adherence to organizational style guides within the Quarto publishing system. brand.yml simplifies the creation of visually consistent materials that perfectly align with your organization's brand guidelines in HTML reports, presentations, websites, and dashboards.

We'll explore how brand.yml allows you to define your brand's visual identity, including colors, fonts, logos, and more, in a single, centralized location. You will learn how to integrate this configuration file into your Quarto projects, automatically applying the defined style guide to various outputs like reports, presentations, websites, and more. Beyond basic integration, I‚Äôll share practical tips and demonstrate tools that simplify the process of designing and managing your brand.yml file to make brand customization even easier.

Join us to discover how brand.yml can elevate your Quarto documents to a new level of professionalism to ensure that your work is more impactful and on-brand.

title: Back to Basics: Intro to R and Data Wrangling with Transcriptomics
description:
**WHO is this for?**

* If you are new to R & are short-budgeted on time!
* If you'd like to start working with data in R w/o learning all the programming details first!!
* If you have a neat data set (e.g., transcriptomics count data) you'd like to explore w/ basic statistics!
* If you are getting started with base R and want to learn more!
* If any of this is true, this workshop might be for you!

**AGENDA**
5:00‚Äì5:15 Meet & Greet \| üçï\| Set\-up
5:15‚Äì6:25 Workshop: Intro to R/RStudio
6:25‚Äì6:30 Q&A\| How to reach us to continue this conversation\!
SETUP INSTRUCTIONS
\*This is a hands-on workshop. Please bring your laptop

* Before the Workshop: install R & RStudio OR use RStudio Cloud. See full installation instructions: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VfD0bGUJBEzliW4C9Xbmk0_Kvx1aUiwY1A7TzY_B7_s/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VfD0bGUJBEzliW4C9Xbmk0_Kvx1aUiwY1A7TzY_B7_s/edit?usp=sharing)

Having trouble with installation & set-up? Ping us on Slack! Or come 15min early.
**USEFUL RESOURCES**
Software Carpentry's Video Tutorial for installing R and R Studio:

* For Windows Users: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q0PjTAylwoU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q0PjTAylwoU)
* For Mac Users: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5-ly3kyxwEg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5-ly3kyxwEg)

**SET-UP**

* To benefit most from this workshop, please bring your laptop with pre-installed RStudio ([https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/)) and R.
* Please ping us on Discord ([https://discord.gg/hyZKcbGSWw](https://discord.gg/hyZKcbGSWw)) or email us ([aurora.colorado@rladies.org](http://aurora.colorado@rladies.org/)) with questions, if any.

**Sponsor: Gignoux Lab, CU Department of Biomedical Informatics**

* We are statistical and population geneticists interested in the confluence of epidemiology, AI and evolution. We use simulations, new methods, and large-scale datasets to improve personalized medicine. We are interested in improving risk prediction across the spectrum of diversity of human populations, integrating insights from functional genomics, and identifying the clinical and translational potential of modern genomics.
